metadata.title: CVE-2016-7102 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
ownCloud Desktop before 2.2.3 allows local users to execute arbitrary codeand possibly gain privileges via a Trojan library in a "special path" inthe C: drive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7102` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

caja-owncloud - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
dolphin-owncloud - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
libowncloudsync0 - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
nautilus-owncloud - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
nemo-owncloud - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
owncloud-client - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
owncloud-client-cmd - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
owncloud-client-data - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
owncloud-client-l10n - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: owncloud-client package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2').
